name: 4-Allyl-2-methoxyphenol
Reason: 4-Allyl-2-methoxyphenol has a melting point that can be predicted by analyzing its structural components. The basic unit for this compound is phenol, which has a melting point of around -10°C. The allyl group (–CH2–CH=CH2–) adds approximately +20°C due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The methoxy group (–O–) introduces a rigid structure and reduces the melting point by approximately -10°C due to the reduced molecular mobility. The carbonyl group (C=O) adds approximately +20°C due to the increased molecular weight and dipole-dipole interactions. The overall effect of these structural components can be estimated as follows: Phenol base (-10°C), allyl group +20°C, methoxy group -10°C, and carbonyl group +20°C.
